channel.title: How to launch whonix
channel.description:
Hi, I downloaded the two images from this site, which program/s do I need to use to open them? I saw a video where a guy opens them into explorer. Or do I need to copy them into a USB stick with unebootin or similar programs to boot whonix from there as it was a live operative system?
Is there any tutorial on this, please?
Thank you.

item.title: How to launch whonix
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
on which platform we are talking about ?

Virtaulbox , KVM , Qubes ?

but it seems to be u r talking about Vbox.

first u should import them into the vbox, follow these photos:-

Whonix

VirtualBox

Whonix in VirtualBox - Stable Version

after that , first open whonix gateway and wait till it end the installation , then after that open whonix workstation and wait till the end of installation.

then

inside gatetway first (wait till finish) then inside workstation

note:- not recommended to put -y with this command sudo apt-get dist-upgrade , please read:-

Whonix

Security Guide

Computer Security Guide for Whonix Linux for Users, Whonix Hardening

then open Tor browser inside whonix workstation and update to the latest stable version = surf anonymously

note:- preferred to restart whonix GW&WS after running apt-get update&dist-upgrade

Or do I need to copy them into a USB stick with unebootin or similar programs to boot whonix from there as it was a live operative system?

whonix not amnesic , we r looking for maintainers to make this happen.

please read whonix maintainer list

Whonix

Contribute

Buy Support Packages, Spread, Follow, Mirror, Translate, Develop, Testing. Contribute to Free Software / Open Source.

Read full topic

item.title: How to launch whonix
item.dc:creator: robertalrp
item.description:
Hi,
I downloaded the two images from this site, which program/s do I need to use to open them? I saw a video where a guy opens them into explorer. Or do I need to copy them into a USB stick with unebootin or similar programs to boot whonix from there as it was a live operative system?

Is there any tutorial on this, please?

Thank you.
